history.content: Definitely don't take 170, you'll want to take 70 before you do that. I'd imagine your most natural options would be either 61C or 16B since you'll need to take those sooner or later and they'll probably be easier than most upper divs you can take. I personally don't know how hard 188 is but if other people say it's easy as it's reputed and you don't need 70 for it, then that would be a good option.

children.subject: Thank you for your reply! I'm sorry I should have said this before, but I already completed al lower divisions for cs. All I have is upper division left.

history.content:
I'm currently a sophomore taking 61B and Data 100. So far, my spring schedule includes taking CS70 to try and declare CS and also a philosophy breadth class. I took Math 1A/1B and did well in those classes, but other than that am not very confident in my math skills, so I definitely want to focus on 70 next semester. Other than that, what other cs classes are recommended? Ive taken ee16a and was thinking about 188 or 170, but I'm not sure if I meet the prereqs for those classes and if they are also too heavy of workloads.

On a side note, I was also thinking of doubling with econ, but am losing interest from taking econ 100b right now. Otherwise, I'd take 70, Phil breath, and stat 88 to declare econ (and maybe 100a). Any advice is appreciated, thanks!
history.subject: Recommended classes to take Spring 2021
